general_advisory: Farmers are advised to maintain optimum water level & monitor the incidence of Yellow Stem Borer, Leaf folder & Mealy bug in rice crop. In rain deficit condition make necessary arrangement for irrigation to Rice & vegetable crops.

advisory: Provide needful irrigation to rice crops.
Prevailing dry spell may lead to increase in infestation of rice mealy bug, so foliar spraying of Lambda cyahalothrin 4.9CS @250ml/acre is advised.

Due to low rainfall & high temperature in last 3 days, if the damage of stem borer is above ETL i.e. 5% dead heart & 10% leaf damage respectively, soil application of Rynaxypyr 0.4 G@4 kg/acre or Flubendiamide 0.7 G 5kg/acre is advised.
Top dressing of fertilizer is advised 16kg nitrogen per acre within 21 days after transplanting.
For effective weed management spray Bispyribic Na @80ml/acre recommended within 5 days after transplanting.

Current weather condition favours blast and bacterial blight disease in rice nurseries & main field. If blast is noticed, apply 120gm Tricyclazole 75% W.P. and for Bacterial Blight apply 500g Copper Oxichloride 50% W.P. with 200g Plantomycin in 200 liter of water per acre.
Cut the branches during inter-crop to enhance the growth.
Current rainy weather is favourable for attack of insect pest likesemilooper, Bihari hair caterpillar and other foliage feeders. To control these insects, spray Lamba cyhalothrin 4.9CS @ 250 ml/acre.
Remove the borer affected tillers and late formed tillers, tie the cane shoot with two or three together with partially dried lower leaves.
To control Top shot borer in sugarcane foliar spray of Fipronil 5SC @400 ml/acre is advised.
In recent rain deficit condition make necessary irrigation to Brinjal, Chilli, Ridge gourd, Cucumber and Snake gourd.
For the management of wilting and partial wilting in vegetable plants, apply Neem or Karanja cake along with MOP & foliar spray of Tebuconazole @ 1ml/liter can be recommended.
July and August are ideal time of mango planting.
Suitable varieties are Amrapalli, Dusseheri, Chousa, Baganpalli, Totapuri, Bombay green, Suvarnarekha, Himsagar, etc.

Seedling should be planted in pits at a distance of 10m X 10m. The pit size is 1m X 1m X 1m. One year old healthy grafted plant should be preferred. At the time of planting two basket compost, 80 g N, 100 g P2O5 and 60 g K2O fertilizer should be applied.
Collect 3000 fingerlings per acre pond from a reliable establishment producing fish.
If someone want to produce three types of fish, release 900 vakur, 1200 rohi and 900 mirikali twins.
Give sufficient drinking water to animals.
If the animals have not yet been vaccinated against FMD, Haemorrhagic Septicaemia, Black Quarter, Enterotoxemia etc., these must be done.
